mechanics.condition: Target is a corpse of your choice within range AND has a mouth AND is not undead AND was not the target of this spell within the last 10 days
mechanics.outcome: Corpse gains semblance of life and intelligence for communication, allowing it to answer questions

mechanics.condition: Corpse does NOT have a mouth
Corpse was the target of 'Speak with Dead' within the last 10 days
Number of questions asked to the corpse exceeds five

mechanics.outcome: Corpse knows only what it knew in life, including languages it knew
Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive

mechanics.condition: Caster is hostile to the corpse OR corpse recognizes caster as an enemy
mechanics.outcome: Corpse is not compelled to offer a truthful answer

mechanics.trigger: Corpse is asked about post-death events
mechanics.outcome: Corpse does not comprehend anything that has happened since it died

mechanics.trigger: Corpse is asked to speculate about the future
mechanics.outcome: Corpse cannot speculate about future events

mechanics.trigger: Caster attempts to impart new information to corpse

description_text: You grant the semblance of life and intelligence to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer the questions you pose. The corpse must still have a mouth and can't be undead. The spell fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the last 10 days. Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are hostile to it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn't return the creature's soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can't learn new information, doesn't comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can't speculate about future events.
